required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial Of PF-00299804 In Patients With Advanced Refractory Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1/2, OPEN-LABEL, SINGLE ARM TRIAL TO DETERMINE THE RECOMMENDED PHASE 2 DOSE AND EVALUATE THE EFFICACY OF PF-00299804 IN PATIENTS IN KOREA WITH KRAS WILD TYPE ADVANCED NSCLC, WHICH IS REFRACTORY TO CHEMOTHERAPY AND ERLOTINIB OR GEFITINIB

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety and efficacy of PF-00299804 in patients with advanced lung cancer.

primary_outcome.description: The highest dose at which less than (<) 33 percent (%) of participants experienced dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) was to be designated as the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) as well as the RP2D. DLT was defined as any of the following events: Grade 3/4 (severe or life-threatening/ disabling adverse event [AE]) nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea (despite the use of adequate/maximal medical intervention and/or prophylaxis); Grade greater than or equal to (>=) 3 (severe or life-threatening/disabling AE or death related to AE) non-hematological toxicity; delayed (which delayed scheduled treatment for >14 days) recovery from toxicity related to treatment with PF-00299804; Grade 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells per cubic millimeter [cells/mm^3] for 5 or more consecutive days or febrile neutropenia [fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius with ANC <1000 cells/mm^3]); and Grade 4 thrombocytopenia (<25,000 cells/mm^3) or bleeding which required platelet transfusion.

PFS4m was defined as percent chance of being event free (event defined as progressive disease [PD] or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first) at 4 months. Progression was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), as at least 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of longest dimensions (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since the treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Month 6 (PFS6m) - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: PFS6m was defined as percent chance of being event free (event defined as PD or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first) at 6 months. Progression was defined using RECIST, as at least 20% increase in the sum of longest dimensions (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since the treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) at Month 6 (OS6m) - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: OS6m was defined as percent chance of being alive at Month 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response - Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after end of treatment (EOT) (EOT: up to Day 506)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. CR: disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR: at least 30 % decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LDs) of target lesion, taking as reference the baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Soluble Protein Biomarkers Level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 (C1D1, Baseline), Day 1 of each odd-numbered cycle up to Cycle 17 for both Phase 1 and Phase 2
secondary_outcome.description: Blood specimens were analyzed at a sponsor-designated laboratory for analysis of shed proteins/receptors related to Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (HER) signaling (epidermal growth factor receptor [EGFR], HER2). These measurements were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). The data for all Phase 1 participants was combined for this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR), Kirsten Rat Sarcoma (KRAS), and Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor-2 (HER2) Mutation Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor tissue was analyzed at a sponsor-designated laboratory to investigate EGFR, KRAS and HER2 status (wild type or mutated). Participants who did not provide samples for central laboratory analysis confirmation were classified as "unknown". The data for all Phase 1 participants was combined for this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9 for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hour Post-Dose (AUC0-24) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-24: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to 24 hours post dose. Data in "PF- 00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg- Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9
secondary_outcome.description: AUClast: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUCinf) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9
secondary_outcome.description: AUCinf: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - ∞). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - ∞).

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulation Ratio (Rac) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C0D-9, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14
secondary_outcome.description: Rac was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUC0-24 (C0D-9).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Plasma Concentration (Cavg) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
secondary_outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Linearity Ratio (Rss) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14
secondary_outcome.description: Rss was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUCinf (C0D-9).

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose) on C2D1, C3D1, C4D1
secondary_outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment (up to Day 889)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: included global health status/quality of life (QoL), functional (Fn) scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), symptom scales (fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting), and single items (dyspnea, appetite loss, insomnia, constipation, diarrhea, and financial difficulties). Scores were averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher score for Global Qol/Fn scales=better level of QoL/functioning or higher score for symptom scales/items=greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales >=10; for symptom scale/item <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales <=-10; for symptom scale/item >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10 for Global QoL/Fn scales and symptom scale/item) and participants in each category are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Lung Cancer Module (EORTC QLQ-LC13) - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment (up to Day 889)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-LC13 consisted of 13 questions relating to disease symptoms specific to lung cancer and treatment side effects typical of treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. The 13 questions comprised 1 multi-item scale for dyspnea and 10 single-item symptoms and side effects (coughing, hemoptysis, sore mouth, dysphagia, peripheral neuropathy, alopecia, chest pain, arm pain, other pain, and medicine for pain). Scores averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher symptom score = greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10) and participants in each category are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Total Score - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1D1 (baseline), D1 of each subsequent cycle up to C44
secondary_outcome.description: DLQI: 10-item questionnaire to measure how much the participant's skin problem has impacted their life over the previous week. All questions were answered on a 4-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not at all/not relevant) to 3 (very much/prevented work or studying). The DLQI was calculated by summing the score of each question and ranged from 0 to 30, where higher scores indicate more quality of life impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Overall Response (BOR) - Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after EOT (EOT: up to Day 1723)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with BOR according to RECIST: CR= disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR= at least 30% decrease in sum of LDs of target lesion, taking as reference baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Stable/no response= neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. Objective progression= at least a 20% increase in sum of LDs of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after EOT (EOT: up to Day 506 for Phase 1 and up to Day 1723 for Phase 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Time in weeks from first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause minus the date of the first CR or PR [which ever occurred first] that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 7. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.

intervention.description: Single arm (no comparator) study, oral once daily dosing, dose escalation (it is a phase 1/2 study) until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of consent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced NSCLC
- Prior treatment with and failure of at least one regimen of chemotherapy and erlotinib or gefitinib
- Prior treatment with no more than two chemotherapy regimens, including adjuvant treatment
- Measurable disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chemotherapy, radiotherapy, biological or investigational agents within 4 weeks of baseline disease assessment
- Patients who lack of tolerance of erlotinib therapy
- Patients with known brain Metastases
- Patients with demonstrated history of or presence of interstitial lung disease.

facility.name: Seoul National University Hospital, Department of Internal Medicine
Severance Hospital, Yonsei University College of Medicine, Yonsei Cancer Center
Samsung Medical Center, Department of Medicine

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

baseline.population: Data for baseline characteristics was pre-specified in statistical analysis plan to be analyzed and summarized per phase.

group.title: PF-00299804 - Phase 1 All Participants
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) - Phase 1
outcome.description: The highest dose at which less than (<) 33 percent (%) of participants experienced dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) was to be designated as the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) as well as the RP2D. DLT was defined as any of the following events: Grade 3/4 (severe or life-threatening/ disabling adverse event [AE]) nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea (despite the use of adequate/maximal medical intervention and/or prophylaxis); Grade greater than or equal to (>=) 3 (severe or life-threatening/disabling AE or death related to AE) non-hematological toxicity; delayed (which delayed scheduled treatment for >14 days) recovery from toxicity related to treatment with PF-00299804; Grade 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells per cubic millimeter [cells/mm^3] for 5 or more consecutive days or febrile neutropenia [fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius with ANC <1000 cells/mm^3]); and Grade 4 thrombocytopenia (<25,000 cells/mm^3) or bleeding which required platelet transfusion.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Day 21
outcome.population: As-treated population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: PF-00299804 - Phase 1 All Participants
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) - Phase 1
measure.description: The highest dose at which less than (<) 33 percent (%) of participants experienced dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) was to be designated as the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) as well as the RP2D. DLT was defined as any of the following events: Grade 3/4 (severe or life-threatening/ disabling adverse event [AE]) nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea (despite the use of adequate/maximal medical intervention and/or prophylaxis); Grade greater than or equal to (>=) 3 (severe or life-threatening/disabling AE or death related to AE) non-hematological toxicity; delayed (which delayed scheduled treatment for >14 days) recovery from toxicity related to treatment with PF-00299804; Grade 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count [ANC] <500 cells per cubic millimeter [cells/mm^3] for 5 or more consecutive days or febrile neutropenia [fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius with ANC <1000 cells/mm^3]); and Grade 4 thrombocytopenia (<25,000 cells/mm^3) or bleeding which required platelet transfusion.
measure.population: As-treated population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Month 4 (PFS4m) - Phase 2
outcome.description: PFS4m was defined as percent chance of being event free (event defined as progressive disease [PD] or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first) at 4 months. Progression was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), as at least 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of longest dimensions (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since the treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Month 4
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all enrolled participants.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Month 4 (PFS4m) - Phase 2
measure.description: PFS4m was defined as percent chance of being event free (event defined as progressive disease [PD] or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first) at 4 months. Progression was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), as at least 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of longest dimensions (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since the treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

Progression was defined using RECIST, as at least 20% increase in the sum of longest dimensions (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since the treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

measure.description: OS6m was defined as percent chance of being alive at Month 6.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response - Phase 1
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. CR: disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR: at least 30 % decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LDs) of target lesion, taking as reference the baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after end of treatment (EOT) (EOT: up to Day 506)
outcome.population: Response-evaluable population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication, had an adequate baseline tumor assessment, and had at least 1 on-study tumor assessment after first dosing.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response - Phase 1
measure.description: Percentage of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. CR: disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR: at least 30 % decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LDs) of target lesion, taking as reference the baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Response-evaluable population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication, had an adequate baseline tumor assessment, and had at least 1 on-study tumor assessment after first dosing.

outcome.title: Soluble Protein Biomarkers Level
outcome.description: Blood specimens were analyzed at a sponsor-designated laboratory for analysis of shed proteins/receptors related to Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (HER) signaling (epidermal growth factor receptor [EGFR], HER2). These measurements were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). The data for all Phase 1 participants was combined for this outcome.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 (C1D1, Baseline), Day 1 of each odd-numbered cycle up to Cycle 17 for both Phase 1 and Phase 2
outcome.population: Biomarker analysis set: all enrolled participants who had baseline samples submitted as per Institutional Review Board/Independent Ethics Committee approval and participant consent. Data was pre-specified in statistical analysis plan to be analyzed and summarized per phase. Number analyzed = participants evaluable at specified time-point.

group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg or 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

outcome.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9 for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK): all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 during Phase 1 or PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles during Phase 2, until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
measure.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK): all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

outcome.title: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
outcome.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 during Phase 1 or PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles during Phase 2, until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
measure.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
measure.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

outcome.title: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9)
outcome.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
measure.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.
measure.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hour Post-Dose (AUC0-24) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
outcome.description: AUC0-24: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to 24 hours post dose. Data in "PF- 00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on Cycle 0 Day -9 (C0D-9) for Phase 1, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14 for Phase 1 and 2
outcome.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 during Phase 1 or PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles during Phase 2, until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hour Post-Dose (AUC0-24) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
measure.description: AUC0-24: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to 24 hours post dose. Data in "PF- 00299804 45 mg" treatment arm at C0D-9 represents participants from Phase 1 only and at C1D14 represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
measure.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. "number analyzed"=participants evaluable for specified time-point. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg- Phase 1
outcome.description: AUClast: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration.
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9
outcome.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg- Phase 1
measure.description: AUClast: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration.
measure.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUCinf) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
outcome.description: AUCinf: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - ∞). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - ∞).
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9
outcome.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUCinf) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
measure.description: AUCinf: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - ∞). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - ∞).
measure.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

outcome.title: Accumulation Ratio (Rac) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
outcome.description: Rac was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUC0-24 (C0D-9).
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C0D-9, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14
outcome.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Accumulation Ratio (Rac) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
measure.description: Rac was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUC0-24 (C0D-9).
measure.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

outcome.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis.

measure.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.

outcome.title: Linearity Ratio (Rss) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
outcome.description: Rss was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUCinf (C0D-9).
outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24, 72, 144, 216 hours post-dose on C0D-9, 0 (pre-dose), 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 hours post-dose on C1D14
outcome.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.description: Rss was calculated by dividing AUC0-24 (C1D14) by AUCinf (C0D-9).
measure.population: PK analysis set for Phase 1 included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration.

outcome.title: Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
outcome.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose) on C2D1, C3D1, C4D1
outcome.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis."number analyzed" = participants evaluable for specified time-point.

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 during Phase 1 or PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles during Phase 2, until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of PF-00299804 30 mg and PF-00299804 45 mg
measure.description: Data in "PF-00299804 45 mg" treatment arm represents participants from both Phase 1 and Phase 2.
measure.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 measured plasma concentration. PK analysis was done by dose level instead of by phase. Participants started from the same dose level were combined together for PK analysis."number analyzed" = participants evaluable for specified time-point.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) - Phase 2
outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: included global health status/quality of life (QoL), functional (Fn) scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), symptom scales (fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting), and single items (dyspnea, appetite loss, insomnia, constipation, diarrhea, and financial difficulties). Scores were averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher score for Global Qol/Fn scales=better level of QoL/functioning or higher score for symptom scales/items=greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales >=10; for symptom scale/item <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales <=-10; for symptom scale/item >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10 for Global QoL/Fn scales and symptom scale/item) and participants in each category are reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment (up to Day 889)
outcome.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) - Phase 2
measure.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: included global health status/quality of life (QoL), functional (Fn) scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), symptom scales (fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting), and single items (dyspnea, appetite loss, insomnia, constipation, diarrhea, and financial difficulties). Scores were averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher score for Global Qol/Fn scales=better level of QoL/functioning or higher score for symptom scales/items=greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales >=10; for symptom scale/item <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline: for Global QoL/Fn scales <=-10; for symptom scale/item >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10 for Global QoL/Fn scales and symptom scale/item) and participants in each category are reported.
measure.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Lung Cancer Module (EORTC QLQ-LC13) - Phase 2
outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-LC13 consisted of 13 questions relating to disease symptoms specific to lung cancer and treatment side effects typical of treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. The 13 questions comprised 1 multi-item scale for dyspnea and 10 single-item symptoms and side effects (coughing, hemoptysis, sore mouth, dysphagia, peripheral neuropathy, alopecia, chest pain, arm pain, other pain, and medicine for pain). Scores averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher symptom score = greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10) and participants in each category are reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment (up to Day 889)
outcome.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure. Medicine for pain was not summarized because a more comprehensive and reliable summary of concomitant medications was reported separately.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Change in European Organization for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Lung Cancer Module (EORTC QLQ-LC13) - Phase 2
measure.description: EORTC QLQ-LC13 consisted of 13 questions relating to disease symptoms specific to lung cancer and treatment side effects typical of treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. The 13 questions comprised 1 multi-item scale for dyspnea and 10 single-item symptoms and side effects (coughing, hemoptysis, sore mouth, dysphagia, peripheral neuropathy, alopecia, chest pain, arm pain, other pain, and medicine for pain). Scores averaged, transformed to 0-100 scale; higher symptom score = greater degree of symptoms. Overall scale change is categorized as Improved (if average scales change from baseline <=-10), Worsened (if average scales change from baseline >=10), and Stable (if average scales change from baseline >-10 but <10) and participants in each category are reported.
measure.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure. Medicine for pain was not summarized because a more comprehensive and reliable summary of concomitant medications was reported separately.

class.title: Pain in arm or Shoulder: Improved
Pain in arm or Shoulder: Worsened
Pain in arm or Shoulder: Stable

outcome.title: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Total Score - Phase 2
outcome.description: DLQI: 10-item questionnaire to measure how much the participant's skin problem has impacted their life over the previous week. All questions were answered on a 4-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not at all/not relevant) to 3 (very much/prevented work or studying). The DLQI was calculated by summing the score of each question and ranged from 0 to 30, where higher scores indicate more quality of life impairment.
outcome.time_frame: C1D1 (baseline), D1 of each subsequent cycle up to C44
outcome.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point for each treatment arm, respectively.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Total Score - Phase 2
measure.description: DLQI: 10-item questionnaire to measure how much the participant's skin problem has impacted their life over the previous week. All questions were answered on a 4-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not at all/not relevant) to 3 (very much/prevented work or studying). The DLQI was calculated by summing the score of each question and ranged from 0 to 30, where higher scores indicate more quality of life impairment.
measure.population: FAS included all enrolled participants. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point for each treatment arm, respectively.

outcome.title: Best Overall Response (BOR) - Phase 2
outcome.description: Number of participants with BOR according to RECIST: CR= disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR= at least 30% decrease in sum of LDs of target lesion, taking as reference baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Stable/no response= neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. Objective progression= at least a 20% increase in sum of LDs of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after EOT (EOT: up to Day 1723)
outcome.population: Response-evaluable population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication, had an adequate baseline tumor assessment, and had at least 1 on-study tumor assessment after first dosing.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Best Overall Response (BOR) - Phase 2
measure.description: Number of participants with BOR according to RECIST: CR= disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. PR= at least 30% decrease in sum of LDs of target lesion, taking as reference baseline sum LD, associated to non-progressive disease response for non-target lesions. Stable/no response= neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD. Objective progression= at least a 20% increase in sum of LDs of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of LD recorded since treatment started and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions and/or appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
measure.population: Response-evaluable population included all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication, had an adequate baseline tumor assessment, and had at least 1 on-study tumor assessment after first dosing.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Time in weeks from first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause minus the date of the first CR or PR [which ever occurred first] that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 7. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or initiation of new anti-cancer therapy or death, assessed every 2 (odd-numbered) cycles up to 12 months after EOT (EOT: up to Day 506 for Phase 1 and up to Day 1723 for Phase 2)
outcome.population: Analysis population included sub-set of participants from response-evaluable population, who had a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

group.title: PF-00299804 30 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 1
group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: Time in weeks from first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause minus the date of the first CR or PR [which ever occurred first] that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 7. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
measure.population: Analysis population included sub-set of participants from response-evaluable population, who had a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of 95% confidence interval was not reached.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded from the time that the participant provided informed consent through and including 28 calendar days after the last administration of the investigational product.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious AE (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in 1 participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 30 milligram (mg) tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 30 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.description: A single dose of PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally on or before Day -9 followed by PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

group.title: PF-00299804 45 mg - Phase 2
group.description: PF-00299804 45 mg tablet orally once daily continuously in 21-day cycles starting from Day 1 until unacceptable toxicity, disease progression, withdrawal from the trial, or death.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
